comments.commentBody: He is unhinged. What will it take to invoke Article 25?
What happened to Mr. Presidential???

I never thought we'd see a real life sequel to the 80's movie "Red Dawn." Now we have Red Don and the Russians truly have their grip on most of the White House crooks. Wake up, Republicans, this isn't a movie or reality show. Our Democracy is under siege. You helped put a totally unqualified, ego-driven failed businessman in wayyyy over his head. I'm sure Putin thanks you.

Trumps acting like one of those bratty alt-right internet trolls.... just hurling baseless accusations around as he pleases. Has our government turned into an extension of the internet? Is there any way to force Trump to put up (evidence) or shut up?

Can people still sue for character defamation? This behavior needs to be stopped via a punishment.

I don't trust mendacious Obama, because he is capable of doing such crooked things. First, he said there was no agency tapping citizen's phones, yet he knew about NSA doing such things, and privy to such information. Second, he shielded Hillary from the FBI, and supported her corrupt, lying campaign to fool the people. These actions will provide support that he had intentions to tap someone's phone to help Hillary's campaign. If Russia can support Trump, according to NYT conspiracies, why not Obama doing the dirty work for Hillary. Third, he is a sleazy and dishonest personality; for instance, he even tapped the phone of a close ally, Angela Merkel, and other foreign leaders. Finally, NYT cited there were no evidences, yet they have supported a case based on "no credible evidences" on the Russian hacking of elecitons and that hacking changed the fate of elections. Instead, they presented "some officials said so, and some officials believe so" to support their evidences, which is nothing but fake news stuff.  In short, Obama would have definitely done such a thing, considering his disingenuous personality, and Trump is right in accusing him.

I don't think there is anything with facts here. It is an open secret that Obama knew about NSA's activities, and even spying on Merkel's phone, who happens to be a steadfast ally. If you still believe that Obama did not support Hillary during the past election campaign, then you are definitely living in a liberal bubble. You can disagree with my argument, but the evidences are there; you can look it up. The only question you can argue is: whether Obama really tracked Trump's phone? Does Trump provide any evidences or claim to present anything to support his assertions? Those are open questions. Or you could argue that Obama is a man of integrity, because of such and such reasons. Instead, claiming that I don't have facts to back it up sounds ridiculous. No wonder liberals are living a day-dream!

I never said that or asked for anything. You just made the most common errors liberals make: the lethal strawman. You just conflate what I said with something what I didn't say or imply. I said Obama lacked a honest personality, because he knew the shady dirty work inside the secret services, yet he kept his mouth shut or expressed an affected personality. In doing so, he lied to the public. So, why should someone believe such a personality. If you hate Trump for a liar, then Obama is as much as a liar-in-chief. But I never questioned about his birth or whatever nonsense. You just made things up to attack my argument, which would fail for the very reason you tried to attack a fake argument, which I didn't create in the first place.
I wish liberal people in NYT can argue without resorting to various logical fallacies, such as straw man, red-herring, and false equivalency.
Mr. Trump, have you not decency?

Mr. Trump's vision is one of a shriveled up America, busy keeping the rest of the world out; fearfully cowering behind walls. Increased weapons and decreased diplomacy/relationship may make some feel "safe," indeed, in a literal sense the country may be safer. The price will be that the world will move on.

Other world leaders will rise (e.g., China); they will become the center of trading blocks and economic leaders. Like "Great" Britain this country will become less significant, less powerful, and less a leader. Trump and his fans will be "safe" because no one out there will bother.

We are so helpless against the foul Gargantua ego flailing that is wrecking reeking havoc on our Beloved Community, taking safety and health-care away from our families and neighbors, leaving children shuddering with tears -- the grotesque threat is so severe to nation and perhaps even world that some schadenfreude on It/Id's gobbling & guzzling habits is our only recourse for any few moments of solace.

As long as there are women and men, women will seek contraception + abortion.

The question is whether you want to force women back into alleys or whether reliable contraception, and legal and rare abortions will be available.

I cannot believe we are still fighting this battle. I thought this was settled 40+ years ago.

No more excuses. This man is mentally unstable and cannot be president. It is time for politicians of both parties to get together and save this country before he does something truly terrible and irrevocable.

Yup...This is the dude who has the code for the nukes.  And let me just ask you all something:  Do you not believe that he is just itching to push that button?  He is a mental case, and he has no control.  If the right powers that MIGHT, SHOULD, or WOULD be in charge of controlling or removing him do not act NOW, those people will be responsible when something irrevocably disastrous occurs.
Obviously Dave you're the kind of guy who is easily confused by compound sentences.

Show us citizens the proof DT before you make such nonsensical allegations.  I wish you would think before you speak or tweet.  You have made the US a laughing stock in the world.  You have caused so much of unhappiness among the citizens of this country.  I wish you would just stop and step down.  You are not meant for this office.  You are the pot calling the kettle black.

I wish I was laughing....the reality is I'm cringing in horror and fearing for the future of American democracy, not to mention what other damage he might wreak on the rest of the world.

God help America... you've made a wacko the most powerful man in the world....

I'm sincerely curious. Given the volumes of vituperative bile that many commenters and writers at the NYT pump out at every new piece of news, does anyone here doubt that the Obama WH would not violate the law to obtain information it deemed vital to the national security of the United States?

Given what we know of the former (?) administration's history of illegal surveillance (including of the press), and willingness to tell any lie, I see no reason to believe a word of denial on this topic. DWS and DB were not forced from power for playing by the rules.

The argument that the political wiretapping is only done legally with court orders signed by judges is silly enough not to merit serious consideration. Privacy is non-existent in the modern world and any suggestion that political operatives are not bugging one another borders insults our intelligence.
Sounds like you're still waiting to see Obama's long-form birth certificate. You should probably mention this to your doctor during your next check-up.

For a moment, think about what you're saying. Because you believe that Obama would violate any law he saw obstructing his access to information, you now suggest that Trump can make any claim consistent with that and be required to offer no evidence, and you're just fine with that. Does that stance truly make sense to you? Anything that can be true, is true, even with no evidence to support it.
Heck yes I doubt it Chunga. If obtaining legal permission is a joke why would OB bother breaking the law? Your in the know posturing is mere self contradiction.
Okay, you are just not making any sense.

If you're still waiting to see the evidence, then you haven't read the papers for several months, even going on 9 months!

You're willfully ignoring the conclusions of 17 different intelligence agencies that Russia interfered in the election.

The public evidence is accumulating. The Russia-Trump connections and revelations are mounting day by day.

You have to be an ostrich not to see it!

And if there are no abortions, there will be untold numbers of unwanted pregnancies (and most women who don't want babies don't want them because they can't afford to raise them properly themselves).

Shouldn't the richest, most powerful nation on the planet be able to provide proper medical and reproductive care to the gender that makes up more than half the population? And if the government AND Planned Parenthood can't or don't pay for those abortions, the taxpayer will be paying for many of those children forever.

“Curiouser and curiouser!”

― Lewis Carroll, Alice in Wonderland

I don't know, Ross. This series you've wedded yourself to just seems kind of utopian.

I believe in the art of the possible. This proposal simply isn't that, in our current political climate.

If you really want to do away with racial set-asides, then why not counter it with something really, really meaningful: a program to protect and enshrine voting rights? That's right, a national ID program that would supersede anything a southern state could enact.

The national ID could be linked to a social security number: just about every citizen has one of those. All that's necessary to get this new voter ID would be to show your card, and have a photo taken--like a driver's license but not linked to driving.

When every person of color can vote without fear, they could afford to lose racial preferences in hiring and college in return for the opportunity to vote for the party that best represents their interests.

In other words, why would educational and hiring preferences be needed if opportunity was truly shared through the exercise of universal franchise, without limits, without mean-spirited state laws designed for the express purpose of keeping Democrats out of power?

Such an ID is fine as long as it would not set free people to vote in the state of their choice.  How many kids from New York and New Jersey, dependents in their home state and taken as such on parents' tax returns, with home state driver's license in pocket, voted in New Hampshire in November?

@ Christine McM - Christine that is no. 1 in the list of policies to be instituted at the same time that the Census Bureau ends use of "race" classification (comment submitted 02:23 EST 3/5). In the submission I avoided pointing to Sweden since this triggers unfortunate writing in certain commenters but this is the system in Sweden made possible in part by the needs associated with Universal Health Care. Every person must have a photo ID with Swedish Personal ID number on it since that must be shown to access health care. This makes possible high-level epidemiological research as one of many benefits.

Larry L.
Only-NeverInSweden.blogspot.com

How many people who are registered to vote, chose not to vote in the last presidential election?   People of all colors, nationalities, economic standing, etc., willingly stayed away from the polls--and many for foolish reasons.  It's something deeper than ID cards that's wrong with our citizenry:  perhaps ignorance?  lack of education? indifference?

No. Absolutely not. Nonsense of this caliber deserves to be met with complete silence from Obama. Lie down with spray-tanned pigs and you will get muddy...

The campaign is OVER. Time for Trump to face the music re: his Russia connections, not create another baseless distraction.

Enough.

Lies and distraction, ad nausea. He's not fooling anyone but his base.
His strategy needs to be publicized for what it is every times he employs it.
We should not spend any time trying to search for evidence that he is lying or wrong. Just paste his cheap modus operandi all over the media.
He is despicable.

@NYT, stop focusing on the crazy things he tweets. Throughout the campaign, the transition period, and now his presidency, Trump continues to shift the narrative towards ridiculous conflicts when he is under pressure. Focus on Sessions and Russia, and stop pandering to the same tricks that he utilized during the campaign and since. The majority of the American people care far less what vitriol he spews about the media and those who oppose him at 5am on the toilet, than they do about concrete instances of abuse of power and his policies.

Every morning, Trump takes a dump on America, via his tweets. This guy is not only un-presidential, he is un-American. He is sick, depraved, desperate, gullible and delusional. Worse, he thinks we all are as delusional as he is! I want him OUT. I am sick of paying for his weekly vacations in Florida, for his mail-order bride to live in luxury in NYC, for his family to be in D.C. They all need to go away. They are a pox on our democracy and have made us the laughing stock of the world. I am embarrassed and ashamed of what he and his administration are trying to do to all Americans. He is a liar and a thief and deserves to be behind bars. Turn off the Twitter and turn on the wheels of justice, NOW. #nevermypresident

Oh boy, atb, did you ever hit the nail on the head! I could not agree with you more!

Yes, NOW!
So for the last 2 months all kinds of accusations have been leveled at Trump with "NO PROOF". Now all the libs are demanding proof about Obama wiretapping, go figure.

No, Mike, we are not going to move to another country.  We were born here, and we are Americans, and the last time I looked, America was a free country.  Yes, trump and his cohorts are trying to change that, but we still have some protections, like free speech.  Unfortunately we are dealing with a president who is mentally ill, vindictive, perverted, dishonest, immature, narcissistic, and who knows nothing about government, practices thievery, and is a pathological liar.  So we will express our opinions until Hell freezes over, and you are free to do the same.  We do not have to be happy about having a psychological misfit as president, who has surrounded himself with an entire fleet of miserable crooks and liars.  If you do not like people expressing opinions that do not agree with yours, perhaps it is you who needs to move to another country...where that kind of censorship is the norm.  Some place like maybe...Syria, or Russia.
Next time Putin will spend more time vetting his American puppet.  It is embarrassing when the richest man in the world can't find good help when he's willing to spend the money.
no he cant
Amen
